question.text:
Observe the diagram given below:



Which of the following statements regarding the above diagram is/are correct?

options.text: <math><mn>1</mn></math>  is a syncytium, as its cytoplasm contains many nuclei.
<math><mn>2</mn></math>  are held together by connective tissue layer called fascia.
<math><mn>2</mn></math>  is the structural as well as the functional unit of muscle.
<math><mn>3</mn></math>  is the membrane which forms a neuromuscular junction along with motor neuron.

solution.text:
The given diagram is the cross sectional view of a muscle showing muscle bundles and muscle fibers. The labels are as follows:

1: Fascicle (Muscle bundle): The skeletal muscle in our body is held together by a number of muscle bundles called fascicles. These fascicles are held together by a layer of collagenous tissue known as fascia.

2: Muscle fiber (Muscle cell): The muscle fiber is a syncytium as its cytoplasm i.e. sarcoplasm contains many nuclei. It is the anatomical unit of muscle but the functional unit is sarcomere.

3: Sarcolemma: It is the membrane which encloses the muscle fibers. The junction between a motor neuron and the sarcolemma of the muscle fibre is called the neuromuscular junction or motor-end plate.
